doc.headline: Beatles sued Apple
doc.post:
Former Beatles and their heirs is dragging Apple to court over the iTunes Music Store, in the latest episode of one of the longest-running battles in the history of British corporate law.

No new case here. This is simply last years case that has finally come round to a hearing in court. Unless of course someone finally decides to back down at the last minute. The English legal system can take a long time to work. Whatever the outcome, I'm sure there will be a lot of press.

From my understanding Apple actually signed an agreement with "Apple" (the music company) explicitly stating that they would not use the trademark in the music related business. Apple (the computer company) subsequently infringed on the agreement. I don't see how Apple (the computer company) is not at fault here since they signed the agreement in the first place.
Having said that this case will be settled with some "mula".
